summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (P5521.06) establishing policy and procedures for searches of housing units, inmates, and inmate work areas. It details various search methods (electronic, pat, visual, digital/instrument, dry cell status, and medical x-ray), cross-gender search restrictions per PREA, and documentation requirements. It is a general policy document, not specific to any individual case.

persons.name: Charles E. Samuels, Jr.
persons.context: Approved the Program Statement as the Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

keyFacts: This is a standard Bureau of Prisons policy document (P5521.06) on inmate search procedures, dated June 4, 2015, effective July 6, 2015.

The policy explicitly restricts cross-gender pat-down searches of female inmates, in accordance with the Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA), allowing them only under 'exigent circumstances' which require immediate action to combat a security threat.

It details procedures for 'dry cell' status (close observation), used when there is reasonable belief an inmate has ingested or concealed contraband in a body cavity and other search methods are inappropriate.

The policy outlines a hierarchy of search methods from least to most intrusive: electronic, pat, visual, digital/simple instrument, and finally medical x-ray or surgical intrusion, which require high-level authorization.
The document was approved by Charles E. Samuels, Jr., the Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the time.
